generic.underDevelopment: As you might see, this page is still under construction. Do not hesitate to use other functionalities.
generic.title: Title
generic.name: Name

import.title: Import existing format
import.message: Are you sure that you would like to insert to underneath file?

about.synopsis: A programmer working as a consultant in different fields. This app was created due to an overflowing idea. Written in React.

data.title: Where remains my data
data.one: At this moment, WritersBlock is just a JavaScript webpage that places your data on your device. This means that WritersBlock doesn't support cross-device data-exchange. However, we are investigating a few ways to export the data from one device to another.
data.two: Why did we went for this approach? Because storing data does not come cheap (yet ...) and as WritersBlock remains a hobby project for now, costs are kept to a strict minimum.

register.title: How do I register?
register.one: If you want to register, simply press the login button on the menu. If you do not see that button, press the 'hamburger' sign (small devices).
register.two: You will find a register button on the left side of your screen. Fill out the profile information and you're ready to go.

story.title: How do I start creating stories?
story.startStory: When you have registered and are logged in, you are able to create stories. Press the menu-item stories and press the 'Add' button. This will guide you throught the first steps of creating your story by adding a title. Do not worry to much about it because you always will be able to update it.
story.startChapter: After the creation of your story title, you will find yourself on the story dashboard in which you are now able to add chapters, characters, items and story specific settings. Navigate to the chapters and create your first chapter.
story.authorDescription: During your process you will find the generic field author description. This field was added for the writer to add memo's about certain items. In the future, I try to establish an export way in which it will also be possible to add a bibliography about all your story specific settings, items and characters. Author description would then be the field that will not be printed out.

events.title: Events
events.one: Events are used to define a characters growth during your story. You can create 2 kinds of events:
events.two: - an event that occurred during a chapter
events.three: - an event that just occurred (without a chapter)
events.four: We now support only text as a description, but the option to raise certain traits is meant to take place here.

relations.title: Relations
relations.description: Relations are used to define the relations between characters. A relation is always between 2 characters and has a relation and reverse relation. Multiple relations can be defined between characters.

markdown.title: How to use MarkDown
markdown.description: A simple and easy-to-use markup language you can use to format virtually any document

logout.message: After logging out, you will be redirected to the home page.

messages.one: Writersblock stores your data in your browsers database. This means that the data will NEVER be synced to a database.
messages.two: However, we will place a small security measure around your data so that evil lookers cannot immediately view your stories.

credentials.error: No user matched the given credentials

item.title: Item
item.description: An item describes an object that can be worn or can be taken.

clothing.title: Clothing
clothing.description: These are objects worn by somebody

armor.title: Armor
armor.description: These are objects worn by somebody wich are also meant for protection

weapon.title: Weapon
weapon.description: These are objects meant to be used as a tool of warfare

trinket.title: Trinket
trinket.description: These are objects that are worn as an accessory.

tool.title: Tool
tool.description: These are objects for general use.

trait.title: Trait
trait.description: A trait is something about your character that makes the character 'his own'.

personal.title: Personal Traits
personal.description: These are traits that a character holds from birth and changes due to character growth.

statistic.title: Statistical Traits
statistic.description: These are traits both for character and item use.

title.title: Title
title.description: An appellation of dignity, honor, distinction, or preeminence attached to a person or family by virtue of rank, office, precedent, privilege, attainment, or lands.

artisan.title: Artisan
artisan.description: A title meant for artisan use. For example: Master blacksmith.

heroic.title: Heroic
heroic.description: A title meant for heroic use. For example: Knight of the round table.

malicious.title: Malicious
malicious.description: A title meant for malicious use. For example: Demon warlord.

race.title: Race
race.description: A race describes the ethnitic origin of an individual

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: A gender describes the sexe of an individual

status.title: Status
status.description: A status describes an abnormality (fixed in time or event) that can be placed on a character or item.

notes.title: Notes
notes.description: A note serves the purpose to write specific informative text.

power.title: Power
power.description: Describes the possibility of an item or character to exert a lot of force.

innate.title: Innate
innate.description: An innate power is active from the moment a character or item is 'born'.

slumbering.title: Slumbering
slumbering.description: A slumbering power becomes active whene a defined moment passes.

taught.title: Taught
taught.description: A taught power becomes active whenever the character is structured about the power by an instructor.

human.name: Human
human.description: A power hungry subject of the realm.

elf.name: Elf
elf.description: A mystical subject of the realm.

dwarf.name: Dwarf
dwarf.description: A small yet skilled subject of the realm.

centaur.name: Centaur
centaur.description: A mythical subject of the realm.

orc.name: Orc
orc.description: A malicious subject of the realm.

troll.name: Troll
troll.description: A big and malicious subject of the realm.

demon.name: Demon
demon.description: A mystical and malicious subject of the realm.

sword.name: Sword
sword.description: A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt with a hand guard, used for thrusting or striking.

staff.name: Staff
staff.description: A weapon most distinguished by it's long shape. Mostly used by wizards.

bow.name: Bow
bow.description: A weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood joined at both ends by a taut string.

dagger.name: Dagger
dagger.description: A short knife with a pointed and edged blade, used as a weapon.

wand.name: Wand
wand.description: A slender rod used by conjurers and magicians.

crossbow.name: Crossbow
crossbow.description: A  bow of a kind that is fixed across a wooden support and has a groove for the bolt and a mechanism for drawing and releasing the string.

cloak.name: Cloak
cloak.description: A sleeveless outdoor overgarment that hangs loosely from the shoulders.

hat.name: Hat
hat.description: A shaped covering for the head worn for warmth, as a fashion item, or as part of a uniform.

gloves.name: Gloves
gloves.description: A covering for the hand worn for protection against cold or dirt and typically having separate parts for each finger and the thumb.

tunic.name: Tunic
tunic.description: A loose garment, typically sleeveless and reaching to the knees.

shirt.name: Shirt
shirt.description: A loose garment, typically with sleeves for each arm and reaching to the knees.

trousers.name: Trousers
trousers.description: A garment covering the body from the waist to the ankles, with a separate part for each leg.

helmet.name: Helmet
helmet.description: A hard or padded protective hat.

platebody.name: Platebody
platebody.description: A body armor of plates of metal.

platelegs.name: Platelegs
platelegs.description: A leg armor of plates of metal.

shield.name: Shield
shield.description: A broad piece of metal or another suitable material, held by straps or a handle attached on one side, used as a protection against blows or missiles.

knife.name: Knife
knife.description: An instrument composed of a blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon.

hammer.name: Hammer
hammer.description: A hammer is a tool that consists of a heavy piece of metal at the end of a handle. It is used, for example, to hit nails into a piece of wood or a wall, or to break things into pieces.

necklace.name: Necklace
necklace.description: An ornamental chain or string of beads, jewels, or links worn round the neck.

amulet.name: Amulet
amulet.description: A charm (such as an ornament) often inscribed with a magic incantation or symbol to aid the wearer or protect against evil.

ring.name: Ring
ring.description: A typically circular band of metal or other durable material, especially one of gold or other precious metal, often set with gems, for wearing on the finger as an ornament.

strength.name: Strength
strength.description: A measure of how physically strong a character is. Strength often controls the maximum weight the character can carry, melee attack and/or damage, and sometimes hit points. Armor and weapons might also have a Strength requirement.

constitution.name: Constitution
constitution.description: A measure of how sturdy a character is. Constitution often influences hit points, resistances for special types of damage (poisons, illness, heat etc.) and fatigue.

defence.name: Defence
defence.description: A measure of how resilient a character is. Defence usually decreases taken damage by either a percentage or a fixed amount per hit. Occasionally combined with Constitution.

dexterity.name: Dexterity
dexterity.description: A measure of how agile a character is. Dexterity controls attack and movement speed and accuracy, as well as evading an opponent's attack

intelligence.name: Intelligence
intelligence.description: A measure of a character's problem-solving ability. Intelligence often determines a character's ability to understand foreign languages and magic. Intelligence can also determine how fast a character can grow.

charisma.name: Charisma
charisma.description: A measure of a character's social skills, and sometimes their physical appearance.

wisdom.name: Wisdom
wisdom.description: A measure of a character's common sense and/or spirituality. Wisdom often controls a character's ability to cast certain spells, communicate to mystical entities, or discern other character's motives or feelings.

willpower.name: Willpower
willpower.description: A measure of the character's mental resistance (against pain, fear etc.) when falling victim to mind-altering magic, torture, or insanity.

perception.name: Perception
perception.description: A measure of a character's openness to their surroundings. Perception controls the chance to detect vital clues, traps or hiding enemies, and might influence combat sequence or the accuracy of ranged attacks.

luck.name: Luck
luck.description: A measure of a character's luck. Luck might influence anything.

notfound.message: The requested page was not found. This probably means that somebody (me) forgot to insert said page. Or remove said link.
